Items.Name: Vintage Unique 50's "Universal " Mixer
Items.Description: Up for auction is a maroon and off white "Universal" brand mixer. This mixer is unique in that their are 10 settings as follows:adding(ingredients,stirring);mashing(vegetables,potatoes);blending(heavy batters);creaming(vegetables,potatoes);mixing(light batter,blending);whipping(mayonaise,dressing);creaming(sugar,butter);beating(egg whites,whip cream);beating(icings,candy); and juicing(fruits,attachments).This mixer can also detach from base to use hand held.It was made by Landers, Frary and Clark,New Britain, CT.This is a very well made mixer and quite alot of power.The color is a maroon handle which I think is very unique in color and the base to be off white.There is only very,very slight pitting on the base (that you could touch up with paint)where the bowl sits that would not be noticable if a bowl were sitting on it. Unfortunately there are no bowls but I have tried Glasbake and other bowls universal to other mixers and they have worked.If you are into "quality" then this mixer is for you.If you have any question please e-mail me.Thank you for l@@king!!Happy Holidays! Items.Name: 1919 ROYAL AUSTRIAN O&EG MARTIN SIGND EGG CUP
Items.Description: if (navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if (navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(http://members.shaw.ca/carnival99/whitemar.jpg) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { //Default to Netscape settings. document.write(" "); } 1919 ROYAL AUSTRIAN O&EG MARTIN SIGND EGG CUP Carnival99 is pleased to bring to auction an Outstanding Example of a Beautiful Egg Cup manufactured by the Brothers Oscar & Edgar Gutherz Very Early Porcelain Makers of the Royal Austrian. This Beauty is Dated and Signed by One of only 5 Known Decorators Employed to Decorate these Beautiful Transfers and very few only Signed and known by only their first name. Well here is an Example of a Rare Fully Hand Written First and last name M. Bryson 1919 {Martin} one of the Original 5 and the only Decorators to be Employed by this very Prestigious Porcelain Firm. The factory was only operational for 20 years but proved to be an extremely successful with American Distributors of the Statue of Butler Brothers and Superb Retailers of Macy's, Sears and Roebucks Led to Great market credibility to the American Consumer through New York Cities Vast Distribution Outlets. These particular decorated pieces were Gutherz Brothers Specialties and appeared on tableware scattered throughout America if and when you are fortunate to Acquire them today. This is an outstanding example of a 1919 Pink Roses in a Dresden Style with a Floral Motif Gold Ornamentation Raised base Hand Decoration and Decorator Signed M. Bryson and marked with the Renown O. & E. G. Royal Austria in the Blue Wreath. Please check all the photos and just see for yourselves how Super this O. & E. G. Showcases. The Napkin Ring is in excellent condition we can find no damage no chips cracks or hairlines a minute gold wear but with the age and the use of the napkin ring this to us does not detract. The Royal Austrian Egg Cup measures approx. 2 3/4" in height 1 7/8" in wide at the opening and 1 3/4" in width on the base. For the Collector of rare and Super Egg Cups please have a Serious Look at this piece as they do not come to auction all that often and especially in this condition. PLEASE ask any and all your questions during the auction up to approx. 10 Hrs of auction ending and we will try and answer your questions forthwith the best we can to make your auction with us all that more enjoyable. As most of our auctions there is a Very Moderate Reserve but Priced Affordable the Reserve will surprise you good folks. We also take the Utmost care in all our Parcel Wrapping to ensure our Valued Customers receive their purchases in a Safe and Timely manner at No extra cost to the consumer. Have Fun and Good Luck. Thanks to all you good folks for viewing our auctions. Shipping on this Oscar & Edgar Gutherz Royal Austrian Egg Cup signed and Dated will be minimal and will be wrapped securely for a safe delivery to our Buyer at no extra charge; actual postage is all that is required with our many thanks. At this time we would like to take this Opportunity to Wish all our past, present & future customers a Very Heartwarming Holiday Seasons Greetings and Especially to have a Safe and Joyous Christmas Season and with all the Very Best Wishes in the New Year to all you Good Folks and your families. I built up a 550+ feedback rating while working with Socko! Comics. Now I am starting over on my own, but that means starting with a feedback of zero. Read my Honesty Policy below. 1966 VF DC TEEN TITANS #1 - 4 QUESTIONS: click here to send an e-mail CONDITION : NEAR MINT OPENING BID: $9.99 HOW TO PAY? MONEY ORDER & PAYPAL HOW TO SHIP? I ship via United States Postal Service for both domestic and international. You pay only the cost required to ship. I do not believe in padding auctions by adding unjustified extra charges. I don't like it when people do it to me, so I won't do it to you. PICTURES: Click on each to get a larger view. _ #1 Front #1 Back #3 Front #3 Back #4 Front #4 Back HONESTY POLICY I have met people in my store who won books on E-Bay that were nowhere near the condition described. It angers me as a seller because it ruins the reputations of dealers as a whole. Simply put, it hurts our market by driving away customers. How Do I Grade? I look at every book and grade it according to six categories: front cover, back cover, corners, edges, spine & staples, interior pages. I give a complete description of each of these sections noting any flaws or defects. Also, I include large scans of the front and back covers. When I have completed the auction page, I am satisfied that you know exactly what you are bidding on and that there will be no surprises at auction's end. So what about returns? At first I offered returns on books. Then I quickly discovered that some people would outbid everyone else by an excessively high amount just to get a look at the book, then ask for a return if they decided they didn't want it. I no longer offer returns. I am confident in my grading and description and have never had a complaint about either. If you are not sure that you want the book then don't bid on it. COMPLETE DESCRIPTION: _ All books have come fromt he same collection and have received the same tender care over the years. Title: Teen Titans Issue(s) & Date(s): #1 - Jan/Feb 1966 - F+ (spine creases, minor corner wear, discoloration along right side & spine edges) #3 - May/Jun 1966- VF (spine creases, minor corner wear) #4 - Jul/Aug 1966 - VF (minor spine creases) Issue #1 features appearances by Batman, Flash, Aquaman & Wonder Woman. Issue #4 features an appearance by Speedy. The following applies to NM books. Front Cover: Strong, even gloss. Clear, bright color. No tears, creaes or fading. Back Cover: Strong gloss, bright color. White to creamy white. Corners: Sharp with minimal wear. Edges: Strong definition. Clean and sharp. Spine & Staples: Strong and clean. Interior Pages: White. Strong, bright color. No pages missing, no cut-outs. The books come bagged and boarded. Check out our other auctions for more great books! MORE QUESTIONS? Items.Name: LEGIONNAIRES 1-6, 9, 13 / 9 Books! DC Comics
Items.Description: LEGIONNAIRES 1-6, 9, 13 SUPERMAN PLUS THE LEGION OF SUPER-HEROES #1 9 Books! When Keith Giffen revamped the dying Legion of Super-Heroes title by aging the characters and ditching those funny looking colorful leotards...he hit an audience that was ready for some sophisticated, yet humorous storylines. But there were a great deal of people who missed the young innocence that the title used to have. So how do you appease both sets of fans? Simple, you have an evil alien race, the Dominion, clone the Legionnaires and incubate them for use as weapons in their plans to invade Earth. But the Legion of Substitute Heroes liberates the clones (who conveniently have incubated to the age they were when they first met Superboy) and both sets of Legionnaires band together to defeat the Dominion. But what do you do now, with two sets of most of your favorite Legionnaires? Again, simple...you give the young clones their own title. Written by Tom & Mary Bierbaum and drawn by Chris Sprouse. I am not a professional grader, so the best way to describe the books are that they're readers copies in pretty decent shape. And don't go knocking the value of a readers copy book. Let's say you're not a collector but you missed the comics of yesteryear, when comics really meant something, and you'd like to relive a little of that magic without having to spend a fortune. Readers copies are the way to go. Now, let's say you are a collector and go through the meticulous process of keeping your comics preserved. If you ever get nostalgic and decide to crack open one of those mylar bags (or whatever protection you use), you run the risk of damaging your precious books. Readers copies allow you to read without fear. Readers Copies. An inexpensive way to explore the valuable history of comics. All proceeds from this auction will be applied to the funding of my film project. Proceeds go to help fund my film, so bids are welcome and appreciated. Thanks for helping make my dream a reality. METHOD OF PAYMENT Postal Money Order or Cashier's Check only, please. SHIPPING $3.90. Everything is shipped Priority Mail, Delivery Confirmation (for my protection as well as yours. This way I can track the shipment should the postal service _misplace_ it. There have been a few people that chose to waive the priority shipping and when their package was lost or delayed, they came back to me demanding that I locate their item, so this shipping method is non-negotiable. Items.Description: Photo Click Image for Larger Preview Description PREVIOUSLY VIEWED SEALED VHS John Woo raises the action bar in this violent, romantic sequel to Brian De Palma's 1996 original. Tom Cruise is back as Ethan Hunt, this time battling wits with rogue IMF agent Sean Ambrose (Dougray Scott). Hunt is ordered to recruit Ambrose's former lover, Nyah Hall (Thandie Newton), to infiltrate his hideout. But Hunt never expected to fall for the lovely young thief he must use for bait. The romantic triangle that ensues gives the film a unique emotional balance that is unusual (and most welcome) for an action picture. Ambrose is after the killer Chimera virus and its antidote, Bellerophon; in the old days Ambrose would have been after world domination, but in this new world order of day trading and Internet stocks, all he wants is to corner the market and make a fortune. This movie is pre-viewed and is in original box. The movie is Sealed, Shrink-wrapped and Guaranteed working. 100% in excellent condition. Items.Description: Star Trek 1983.Included in this lot are the following issues,all nm/m,warehouse copies,1-3;6-14;16-19;24,27-30;33,37,39,40,47,53,54,55 annual1,2,Whos who in star trek 1,2;Guide value ~96.00 Also Note that this scan generally will overstate defects.Nevertheless bid with confidence! A+" -nov 28 2001 feedback, or just to confirm read the Dec 3 2001 feedback of a VF Green Lantern purchase;". Better than described. A+++++ THANKS ";OR read what a buyer of a nm Thor said"Pinpoint grading (an ebay rarity!) Recommend this seller.Dec 3 2001)).All grades are guarenteed within 0.5 of any grading service. The grade quoted above is an accurate grade reflecting the true condition of the book.The price is set so that you will be hard pressed to find as good a deal anywhere else.(This 33% bigger scan( than the books' actual size) magnifies and enlarges defects-it is like looking at the book through a magnification factor). Generally speaking the book possess's a solid intact spine with no splits;staples solidly in place;corners sharp;gloss and color deapth vivid,deep and close to new in appearance;only minor spine stress marks may exist( often similar to thoses produced at original printing);overall a glossy off white to white paged copy offered at an unbeatable initial bid. As we have a large multiple grade inventory of Silver and Golden age books,many will be offered for sale in coming ads.There are many comics being auctioned off on Ebay this week.Combine auctions to save postage.THOUSANDS of other books are still to come including most Marvel and DC titles from 1950 up.Use the BUY IT NOW feature to end the auction and lock out the competition.(Note; on some multiscan auctions we are not able to offer the buy it now feature) We are multiple CBG award winners;EBAY Power sellers;and have 1000 total positive feedbacks(many multiple) since we began here about 2 years ago.Some may remember us for our full page Marvel adds starting in the 1980's.Our Marvel and DC inventory is extensive and often stocked in multiple conditions form the 1950's up...Note.All our scans are "High resolution".That means a magnified, extremley detailed scan which is about 33% LARGER than the actual size of the comic.( so, of course, defects appear about 1/3rd bigger,than if you were viewing the item right in front of you)..Why do we do this?Why do we want the comic to have all the defects OVERSTATED? Here are the reasons; 1)All defects are CLEARLY seen.(in our opinion a small scan is of no use-the grade can be anything). 2) By revealing all defects,you can grade based upon what you like or dislike about a book. 3) No two grades have the same defects,thus a large scan allows you to delineate the key aspects of the book. 4)A large scan will OVERSTATE defects.Defects appear LARGER than what you will see when you get the book.(This applies especially to creases(thicker than actual),and stress marks,and to a lesser extent to color tones,which may show gradations in color not visible with the naked eye).Most of our customers note that the book is nicer when it arrives than what this scan revealed(reasons;the scans bright flood light reveal evey single microscopic impact point,plus defects appear 33% larger.) 5)All our books are guaranteed to be in the same general grade range(within+/- 0.5) if the book is slabbed(within 14 days of purchase) 6) Full exchange privledges on any item purchased.within 7 days. 7) Shipping : Cost; 5.00 for less than 5 comics(priority mail with delivery confirmation) in North America NOTE ;Allow 2 weeks for material to reach you;we often beat that,but increased security screening by the post office can delay shipping time;we take full responsibility.... ..Questions and/or comments? Items.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:18px; color:#FC1230; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#000000; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #000000; } VINTAGE SIXTIES Black Leather Purse/Tote! Click image to view larger version This is a neat black leather vintage purse - probably from the sixties or early seventies when the porthole openings were in style. The hallmark is worn, but it could say MARGOLIN. The bag is has a large carrying capacity. The interior of the purse has a goldtone framed purse, with a flipup clasp. The interior of the purse is lined in black twill and has a gold twill slip pocket. On each side of the center purse are twill lined open compartments, each having their own side zippered pocket. The looped leather strap can pull through and be used as one shoulderstrap, or each end can pull together for a handstrap. There are also four goldtone metal grommets on the bottom. For it's age, this bag is in pretty good shape. The strap itself has some wear and a bit of loose stitching - otherwise the leather is still soft and supple and the interior is great! Make a statement with this nice bag! Dimensions are 12.5"L, 10"H, 3.50"W. Shipping is through U.S. Postal Service with Delivery Confirmation. See shipping cost below. PayPal, Billpoint or Money Order ensures 24-hour shipping. Personal checks may require clearance before shipment. Insurance is $1.10 extra for all items under $50; $2.00 for items $50 to $100. Multiple purchases can be combined to save on shipping. Please include item name and eBay # with your payment and all correspondence. Returns granted only if item was grossly misrepresented. Items.Name: Tom Clark/Tim Wolfe - SANTA BEAR (R) - NEW
Items.Description: Santa Bear item #9120 edition #78 was created by Tim Wolfe of Cairn Studio and is now retired. Santa Bear is 8 1/2" tall, is NEW and in excellent condition. A Certificate of Authenticity will be issued by Cairn Studio. The story card is included. The story is: "On Christmas Eve, young animals throughout all the woods and forests lie awake in their nets, anxiously awaiting the arrival of good ol' Santa Bear. For many of them, it will seem like the longest night of the year, as they are afr too excited to sleep.... After a long winter's nap in the North Cave, Santa Bear emerhes on Christmas Eve, dressed and ready to go to work. His red and white suit resembles that which is worn by his human colleague, Claus. Years of eating Mrs. Bear's cooking has caused Santa Bear's jacket to feel a bit tight! While St. Nick is nusy filling stockings for good boys and girls, Santa Bear will be delivering treats to little critters all across the land. His team of eight minghty mule deer will carry his sleigh from the Everglades to the Yukon - and everywhere in between. If you happen to notice this jolly and plump bruin sneaking through your woodlot on Christmas Eve, you'll know in a moment it mustn't be St. Nick...it's Santa Bear." Buyers to pay a fixed $7.70 shipping charge. Upon receipt of payment, item will be shipped via USPS Priority Mail the following business day. Items.Name: OLD WOODEN STENCILED SPICE BOX / CABINET
Items.Description: This auction is for a Stenciled Spice Box or Cabinet. This cabinet appears to be very old and is in wonderful condition. It is about 12 _ inches tall (about 16 _ inches tall overall), about 10 inches wide and about 5 inches deep. The back is a solid piece of wood and it is not cracked. We did have it hanging on the wall so there are 3 small pieces of felt that could be removed. There are eight (8) drawers with wooden knobs Each drawer has the original stencils and they are very legible. The stencils read SALT, PEPPER, CINNAMON, CLOVES, MUSTARD, SODA, PARSLEY and NUTMEG.
